comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A Capt. Seebohm commanded the German cruiser, Bremen. See June 12, 1912 NYT query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9A06EFD7153CE633A... "GERMAN ADMIRAL TOASTS PRESIDENT; Mayor Gaynor Responds by Toasting the Kaiser at the Luncheon on the Moltke. Rear Admiral von Rebeur-Paschwitz, commanding the visiting German squadron, was the host of Mayor Gaynor and hundreds of other well-known New Yorkers aboard his flagship, the battle cruiser Moltke, yesterday afternoon. The occasion was the Admiral's official reception to more than 2,000 invited guests, and the reception was preceded by an official luncheon on board of each of the three visiting warships, the luncheon guests numbering about fifty." The Bremen was one of the 3 warships and Seebohm hosted the lunch aboard.
